document_data.name: Rimaq al-Nimar
document_data.mainbody: '''Rimaq al-Nimar''', also called the '''Most Reverend Father''' or '''Most Humble Servant of the Enlightened Gods''', was a [[moralist]] and [[wikipedia:emir|emir]] of [[I'tiraf]] in the [[Cities of the Pantheon]] region of [[Zakhara]].
document_data.Activities:
Around [[1367 DR]],{{AQ-time}} Rimaq al-Nimar was the emir of I'tiraf and the most influential leader in the League of the Pantheon.

In addition to being the emir of I'tiraf, Rimaq was also the head of the [[League Conclave]]â€”the governing body for the Pantheist League. He was the fourth member of his lineage to hold this position. Rimaq dreamed that [[Zakharan pantheon|Pantheist Enlightenment]] would prevail through the entire Land of Fate. He corresponded regularly with [[Alyana al-Azzazi]], the Grand Caliph's trusted vizier, knowing that influencing her was the best way to further his goal.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: Rimaq was rumored to be the cause of many troubles and disasters striking the [[Pearl Cities]] region found on the opposite side of the [[Golden Gulf]]. Though troubles in the Pearl Cities certainly benefited Rimaq, he was not a malevolent person who would willingly cause such misfortune.
